title: Massive search of rivers for woman, 22, missing after night out
text:
Rescue teams are scouring rivers in the search for missing Brooke Morris in Merthyr (Picture: PA/Wales News Service)

A massive search of rivers has been carried out for a woman who vanished three days ago following a night out in Merthyr.

Mountain rescue teams are searching for Brooke Morris, 22, who was last seen at around 2.40am on Saturday.

Friends dropped her home but did not enter her property and has not been seen since since.

Police are growing ‘increasingly concerned’ for the welfare of Ms Morris, who plays for rugby for local team Nelson RFC.

She is 5ft 3″ tall, has a slight build with long dark hair, and was last seen wearing boyfriend-style jeans and a red long sleeve top.

Brooke Morris was last seen in the early hours of Saturday following a night out in her hometown (Picture: Wales News Service)

Police and mountain rescuers have now launched a search to find missing Brooke – trawling the mountainside and rivers (Picture: Wales News Service)

Earlier today Nelson RFC shared a picture of Ms Morris and thanked volunteers for their help.

The club said: ‘The response and love shown for Brooke has been amazing.

‘Hats off to her teammates and the endless amount of volunteers that have searched tirelessly the last few days.

‘Brooke you’re one loved girl.’

This morning local councillor Sherelle Jago said water searches were being carried out as part of inquiries.

Brooke disappeared after getting dropped home by friends (Picture: Wales News Service)

Brooke was last seen wearing boyfriend-style jeans and a red long-sleeve top (Picture: PA)

Yesterday, Western and Central Brecon Mountain Rescue teams said they were called to help police search prominent water courses in Treharris.

Local policing inspector Ben Rowe, said: “We’ve had an overwhelming response from the local and wider community – many offering to help with our search for Brooke.

‘We are growing increasingly concerned for her, and we are keeping Brooke’s family, who are understandably so worried, fully updated about the search.’

Anybody who may have seen Brooke is urged to contact 101 immediately, giving reference *378028.

description: Brooke Morris disappeared after getting a lift home at the weekend sparking a huge rescue operation.
